003 * image processing published by Springer-Verlag in various languages and editions.

008 *******************************************************************************/
009package imagingbook.spectral.dft;
010
011import java.util.Arrays;
012
013/**
014 * <p>
015 * Abstract super-class of all two-dimensional DFT/FFT implementations.
016 * Based on associated one-dimensional DFT/FFT methods (see {@link Dft1d}).
017 * See Ch. 19 of [1] for additional details.
018 * </p>
019 * <p>
020 * [1] W. Burger, M.J. Burge, <em>Digital Image Processing - An Algorithmic Approach</em>,
021 * 3rd ed, Springer (2022).
022 * </p>
023 * 
024 * @author WB
025 * @version 2022/10/21
026 * @see Dft1d
027 */
028public interface Dft2d {
029        
030        public int getWidth();
031        public int getHeight();
032        public ScalingMode getScalingMode();
033        
034        // -------------------------------------------------------------
035        
036        public interface Float extends Dft2d {
037                
038                /**
039                 * Returns a suitable 1D DFT of the specified size ({@code float}).
040                 * @param size the size of the DFT
041                 * @return a {@link Dft1d.Float} instance
042                 */
043                public Dft1d.Float get1dDft(int size);
044                
045                /**
046                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
047                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward)
048                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be null.
049                 * 
050                 * @param inRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
051                 * @param inIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
052                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
053                 */
054                public default void transform(float[][] inRe, float[][] inIm, boolean forward) {
055                        checkSize(inRe);
056                        checkSize(inIm);
057                        final int width = this.getWidth();
058                        final int height = this.getHeight();
059
060                        // transform each row (in place):
061                        final float[] rowRe = new float[width];
062                        final float[] rowIm = new float[width];
063                        Dft1d.Float dftRow = get1dDft(width);
064                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
065                                extractRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
066                                extractRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
067                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
068                                insertRow(inRe, v, rowRe);
069                                insertRow(inIm, v, rowIm);
070                        }
071
072                        // transform each column (in place):
073                        final float[] colRe = new float[height];
074                        final float[] colIm = new float[height];
075                        Dft1d.Float dftCol = get1dDft(height);
076                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
077                                extractCol(inRe, u, colRe);
078                                extractCol(inIm, u, colIm);
079                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
080                                insertCol(inRe, u, colRe);
081                                insertCol(inIm, u, colIm);
082                        }
083                }
084                
085                
086                
087                public default void extractRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
088                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
089                                row[u] = g[u][v];
090                        }
091                }
092                
093                public default void insertRow(float[][] g, int v, float[] row) {
094                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
095                                g[u][v] = row[u];
096                        }
097                }
098                        
099                public default void extractCol(float[][] g, int u, float[] col) {
100                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
101                                col[v] = g[u][v];
102                        }
103                }
104                
105                public default void insertCol(float[][] g, final int u, float[] col) {
106                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
107                                g[u][v] = col[v];
108                        }
109                }
110                
111                /**
112                 * Performs an "in-place" forward DFT or FFT on the supplied 2D data.
113                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
114                 * 
115                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
116                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
117                 * @see #transform(float[][], float[][], boolean)
118                 */
119                public default void forward(float[][] gRe, float[][] gIm) {
120                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
121                }
122                
123                /**
124                 * Performs an "in-place" inverse DFT or FFT on the supplied 2D spectrum.
125                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
126                 * 
127                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
128                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
129                 * @see #transform(float[][], float[][], boolean)
130                 */
131                public default void inverse(float[][] GRe, float[][] GIm) {
132                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
133                }
134                
135                public default void checkSize(float[][] A) {
136                        if (A.length != this.getWidth()) 
137                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
138                                                String.format("wrong 2D array width %d (expected %d)", A.length, this.getWidth()));
139                        if (A[0].length != this.getHeight()) 
140                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
141                                                String.format("wrong 2D array height %d (expected %d)", A[0].length, this.getHeight()));
142                }
143                
144                /**
145                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
146                 * @param re the real part of the data
147                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
148                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
149                 */
150                public default float[][] getMagnitude(float[][] re, float[][] im) {
151                        checkSize(re);
152                        checkSize(im);
153                        final int width = re.length;
154                        final int height = re[0].length;
155                        float[][] mag = new float[width][height];
156                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
157                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
158                                        float a = re[u][v];
159                                        float b = im[u][v];
160                                        mag[u][v] = (float) Math.hypot(a, b);
161                                }
162                        }
163                        return mag;
164                }
165        }
166        
167        // -------------------------------------------------------------
168        
169        public interface Double extends Dft2d {
170                
171                /**
172                 * Returns a suitable 1D DFT of the specified size ({@code double}).
173                 * @param size the size of the DFT
174                 * @return a {@link Dft1d.Double} instance
175                 */
176                public Dft1d.Double get1dDft(int size);
177                
178                /**
179                 * Transforms the given 2D arrays 'in-place'. Separate arrays of identical size
180                 * must be supplied for the real and imaginary parts of the signal (forward)
181                 * or spectrum (inverse), neither of which may be null.
182                 * 
183                 * @param gRe real part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
184                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the input signal or spectrum (modified)
185                 * @param forward forward transformation if {@code true}, inverse transformation if {@code false}
186                 */
187                public default void transform(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm, boolean forward) {
188                        checkSize(gRe);
189                        checkSize(gIm);
190                        final int width = this.getWidth();
191                        final int height = this.getHeight();
192
193                        // transform each row (in place):
194                        final double[] rowRe = new double[width];
195                        final double[] rowIm = new double[width];
196                        Dft1d.Double dftRow = get1dDft(width);
197                        for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
198                                extractRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
199                                extractRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
200                                dftRow.transform(rowRe, rowIm, forward);
201                                insertRow(gRe, v, rowRe);
202                                insertRow(gIm, v, rowIm);
203                        }
204
205                        // transform each column (in place):
206                        final double[] colRe = new double[height];
207                        final double[] colIm = new double[height];
208                        Dft1d.Double dftCol = get1dDft(height);
209                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
210                                extractCol(gRe, u, colRe);
211                                extractCol(gIm, u, colIm);
212                                dftCol.transform(colRe, colIm, forward);
213                                insertCol(gRe, u, colRe);
214                                insertCol(gIm, u, colIm);
215                        }
216                }
217                
218                public default void extractRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
219                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
220                                Arrays.fill(row, 0);
221                        }
222                        else {
223                                for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
224                                        row[u] = g[u][v];
225                                }
226                        }
227                }
228                
229                public default void insertRow(double[][] g, int v, double[] row) {
230                        for (int u = 0; u < row.length; u++) {
231                                g[u][v] = row[u];
232                        }
233                }
234                
235                public default void extractCol(double[][] g, int u, double[] col) {
236                        if (g == null) {                        // TODO: check if needed
237                                Arrays.fill(col, 0);
238                        }
239                        else {
240                                for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
241                                        col[v] = g[u][v];
242                                }
243                        }
244                }
245                
246                public default void insertCol(double[][] g, final int u, double[] col) {
247                        for (int v = 0; v < col.length; v++) {
248                                g[u][v] = col[v];
249                        }
250                }
251                
252                /**
253                 * Performs an "in-place" forward DFT or FFT on the supplied 2D data.
254                 * The input signal is replaced by the associated DFT spectrum.
255                 * 
256                 * @param gRe real part of the signal (modified)
257                 * @param gIm imaginary part of the signal (modified)
258                 * @see #transform(double[][], double[][], boolean)
259                 */
260                public default void forward(double[][] gRe, double[][] gIm) {
261                        transform(gRe, gIm, true);
262                }
263                
264                /**
265                 * Performs an "in-place" inverse DFT or FFT on the supplied 2D spectrum.
266                 * The input spectrum is replaced by the associated signal.
267                 * 
268                 * @param GRe real part of the spectrum (modified)
269                 * @param GIm imaginary part of the spectrum (modified)
270                 * @see #transform(double[][], double[][], boolean)
271                 */
272                public default void inverse(double[][] GRe, double[][] GIm) {
273                        transform(GRe, GIm, false);
274                }
275                
276                /**
277                 * Calculates and returns the magnitude of the supplied complex-valued 2D data.
278                 * 
279                 * @param re the real part of the data
280                 * @param im the imaginary part of the data
281                 * @return a 2D array of magnitude values
282                 */
283                public default double[][] getMagnitude(double[][] re, double[][] im) {
284                        checkSize(re);
285                        checkSize(im);
286                        final int width = re.length;
287                        final int height = re[0].length;
288                        double[][] mag = new double[width][height];
289                        for (int u = 0; u < width; u++) {
290                                for (int v = 0; v < height; v++) {
291                                        double a = re[u][v];
292                                        double b = im[u][v];
293                                        mag[u][v] = Math.hypot(a, b);
294                                }
295                        }
296                        return mag;
297                }
298                
299                public default void checkSize(double[][] A) {
300                        if (A.length != this.getWidth()) 
301                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
302                                                String.format("wrong 2D array width %d (expected %d)", A.length, this.getWidth()));
303                        if (A[0].length != this.getHeight()) 
304                                throw new IllegalArgumentException(
305                                                String.format("wrong 2D array height %d (expected %d)", A[0].length, this.getHeight()));
306                }
307        }
308        
309}
